message.content:
cs.IT, cs.SI, cs.SP, cs.MS, cs.LG. 

This paper deals with the problem of sampling spatial fields using sensors that are location-unaware but deployed according to a known statistical distribution. This problem is related to signal processing, information theory, and machine learning. Therefore, the most likely arXiv CS sub-category is cs.IT (Information Theory), which deals with the fundamental limits of data compression, communication, and inference. The paper also involves statistical inference and clustering algorithms, which are related to the sub-categories cs.SI (Social and Information Networks), cs.SP (Signal Processing), and cs.MS (Machine Learning). Finally, the paper proposes an optimization problem to find the optimal probability distribution on sensor locations that minimizes the detection error-probability of the underlying spatial field, which is related to the sub-category cs.LG (Machine Learning).
